name: Adinda Febrina
review: Lawang Sewu is one of Semarang historical tourism objects, which was built during the Dutch colonial. Lawang Sewu means thousand doors, even though it has only 429 doors and 600 large windows. All the materials was imported from Europe. Built in 1904 -1907 as the head office of NIC, one of train's companies in the Dutch East Indies. The building has 4 different building are building A & B the bigger building in the area and the smaller building are C & D. In 1942, Japanese army took over and turned the building dungeon B as underground prisons it supposedly serves as a water reservoir in Dutch era. And the sad stories began. The prison were built 16 tanks measuring 1,5x1,5 meters for 6 prisoners each tank and filled up with the water until their necks. The other prison were 16 standing room size jailed 1 x 1 meter for 5-8 prisoners. And railway to the exit had executions room. The prisons closed for public now as many tourists are taking selfie which is not respect for the victims. If you want to visit, I am suggesting to rent a guide tour and he/she will explain all the details of the building. Grab bicycles rent are also available. Tickets entry only 10K for adult.

name: Ivan Febriand Muhammad
review: Lawang Sewu is a historic building in Indonesia located in Semarang City, Central Java. This building, which used to be the office of the Nederlands-Indische Spoorweg Maatschappij or NIS. It was built in 1904 and completed in 1907. It is located at the Tugu Muda circle which was formerly called Wilhelminaplein. Local people call it Lawang Sewu because the building has so many doors, despite the fact that the number of doors does not reach one thousand. This building has many windows that are tall and wide, so people often think of it as a gate. This old building is the location of a great battle between the AMKA youth or the Train Youth Force against Kempetai and Kidobutai, Japan. Therefore the Semarang City Government includes Lawang Sewu as one of 102 ancient or historic buildings in the city of Semarang that are worth protecting. Currently the old building has undergone a stage of conservation and revitalization carried out by the Unit Preservation of objects and historic buildings of PT Kereta Api Company. During the Japanese occupation in 1942, the basement of the Lawang Sewu building was formerly a drainage channel but was converted into an underground prison as well as a drainage channel. This building is also a silent witness to the fierce battle between the people of Indonesia and the Japanese army, known as the Battle of Five Days in Semarang. This underground jailis is a witness to the torture and massacre of Indonesian people, which was carried out by the Japanese army at the time of forced labor or romusha. name: Benny Pudjiastanto
review: (Translated by Google) The park which presents a view of the class gap between the lower economy class and the upper & middle economic class in the city of Semarang. In the south & west the park has a luxurious house in the hills, while in the east there is a view of dense settlements, of course not forgetting high rise buildings that began to appear in the city of Semarang. This park is one of the cleanest parks in the city of Semarang, perhaps because there are not many visitors, considering its location which is somewhat hidden from the main road. For those who are tired of waiting for sick relatives at Elisabeth Hospital, they can refresh themselves for a while, because the distance is only 5 minutes on foot. Also in the park there is also free Wi-Fi. Because it's still new, the tree isn't shady enough, especially in the circular garden bench. We see a few more years. (Original) Taman yg menampilkan pemandangan kesenjangan kelas antara kelas ekonomi bawah dengan kelas ekonomi menengah & atas di kota Semarang. Di selatan & barat taman ada rumah mewah di perbukitan, sementara di sebelah timur ada pemandangan pemukiman padat, tentunya tidak lupa gedung tinggi yg mencuat mulai bermunculan di kota Semarang. Taman ini salah satu taman di kota Semarang yang paling bersih, barangkali karena tidak banyak pengunjung, mengingat lokasinya yang agak tersembunyi dari jalan utama. Bagi yang penat menunggui kerabat yang sedang sakit di RS Elisabeth bisa sejenak menyegarkan diri ke taman ini, karena jaraknya hanya 5 menit jalan kaki.
